business.headline: Gold rises Rs 3,000, silver up Rs 13,000: Will prices go up further?A sudden spike in gold and silver prices has put bullion back in the spotlight. The rally has shifted focus to the next big question: are prices set to rise even further?

Think Budget 2026 ignored the middle class? Here's what you missedMany middle-class taxpayers finished listening to Budget 2026 with a sense of disappointment. No big announcements, no instant tax relief. But look closer, and the Budget reveals a series of quieter reforms that could meaningfully ease everyday financial pressures.

Sensex jumps 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading 491.04 points higher at 84,071.44, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 168.40 points to trade at 25,862.10. The rise came after a mix of positive global cues, strong buying by foreign investors, and sharp gains in PSU banking stocks.

SBI share price jumps 7% to hit 52-week high. Here's why and if you should buySBI shares have been on a steady rise over the past year. The stock has gained 7.54% in the last five trading sessions and 13.04% over the past one month. Over six months, the shares are up 37.35%, while the one-year gain stands at 53.50%.

How Norway turned oil into a $2 trillion fund that may never run outNorway is more often known as one of the happiest countries in the world which has the best Northern Lights, not as a financial powerhouse. Yet behind this image of calm and comfort sits one of the most powerful financial institutions on the planet.
Sensex opens 400 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; SBI gains 6%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 377.94 points to 83,958.34, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 119.10 points to 25,812.80 as of 9:55 am.

How is the digital shift changing UAE real estate for investors?Investor decisions are now increasingly shaped upstream through digital discovery, data-led targeting, and algorithmic visibility well before a site visit or broker engagement occurs.

Are mutual funds really the best place to invest your money right now?Headlines on the India–US trade deal, India–EU FTA, Budget 2026, swings in gold and silver and a sudden sell-off in IT stocks have followed one another in quick succession, and when so much unfolds at once, many investors end up reacting to every market move.

India agreed to open agriculture, dairy sectors to US players? Piyush Goyal answersEarlier, Piyush Goyal shared the details of the deal that followed a framework interim trade agreement between the two countries, aimed at boosting exports, jobs and market access. The trade deal will formally be signed in March.

Reduced US tariffs of 18% on India come into effect. What it meansThe agreement will reduce US reciprocal duties on Indian exports to 18 per cent, while scrapping tariffs entirely on items such as generic medicines, gems and diamonds, and aircraft components—opening up stronger export prospects across several key sectors.

India-US trade deal to boost exports, safeguard farmers' interests: Piyush GoyalUnion Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the India-US interim trade framework is a historic step toward achieving USD 500 billion in bilateral trade. He announced that reciprocal tariffs on Indian exports to the US will fall sharply from 50% to 18%.

Protection of farmers' interest in US deal surprised some: Govt's dig at OppositionPiyush Goyal dismissed criticism that the India-US trade deal would harm farmers and small producers, asserting that the interim framework fully safeguards their interests.

How India flipped the agri script on Trump? Piyush Goyal revealsUnion Minister Piyush Goyal stressed that India maintained its red lines on agriculture and dairy in its trade deal with the US, while opening its market selectively for certain items like wines and spirits.

What happens if the world's 10 richest people donate half their wealth?A trillion dollars from the world's richest may feel impossible, but pledges like Vedanta chairman Anil Agarwal's prove that big commitments are possible. Imagine what happens if the top ten step forward.

India–US trade deal: Decoding impact of lower 18% tariffs and duty-free boostIndian goods that were slammed with nearly 50% US tariffs last year will now face only 18%, and some key sectors even go duty-free. Here's how the interim pact changes the outlook for exporters.

India to buy $500 billion of US goods in 5 years as new trade deal cuts tariffsIndia's USD 500 billion buying plan will anchor the interim trade framework, as New Delhi will cut tariffs on US goods and Washington will lower duties on Indian exports to 18 per cent under the proposed bilateral pact.

18% tariff, wider US market access: How India gains from trade pact with USIndia and the US have finally agreed on a framework for an interim trade agreement. In this article, we break down what it means and why it matters for India.

Tariffs to fall, markets to open, lakhs of jobs: Piyush Goyal on India-US dealThe agreement will see the US cut reciprocal tariffs on Indian goods to 18 per cent and eliminate duties on products such as generic pharmaceuticals, gems and diamonds, and aircraft parts, boosting export opportunities across key sectors.

India, US unveil interim trade pact; cut tariffs, open $30 trillion marketThe India-US trade deal marks a reset in trade ties, cutting Trump tariffs to 18 per cent and setting the stage for a sweeping bilateral deal amid geopolitical recalibrations.

US stocks hit historic milestone as Dow crosses 50,000 points for first timeUS stocks surged Friday as tech shares rebounded and bitcoin steadied, pushing the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq sharply higher despite lingering worries over heavy AI spending and market volatility.

entertainment.headline: Why Trump slammed Bad Bunny's Super Bowl show - history, identity, culture explained Bad Bunny's Super Bowl halftime show was historic, not just for its music, but for what it represented. From Puerto Rican life to Latin American history, the performance sparked a political backlash from Donald Trump that revealed deeper anxieties around culture, language and belonging in America.

Netflix announces Konkona Sen Sharma, Pratibha Rannta's Accused. Release date out Konkona Sen Sharma and Pratibha Rannta star in Netflix's Accused, premiering February 27. The film examines trust and betrayal amid serious allegations, raising complex moral questions.

Dhurandhar producer: After Sholay, can't think of a film as successful Producer Jyoti Deshpande compared the historic success of Dhurandhar to Sholay after the film crossed Rs 1000 crore at the domestic box office.

Fact Check: Was boy in Bad Bunny's Super Bowl show ICE-detained Liam Conejo? Singer Bad Bunny's Super Bowl halftime show triggered an emotional theory across social media. A child, a Grammy and a viral claim. Here's what actually happened.

Leonardo DiCaprio, Tobey Maguire's dance-off turns Super Bowl into a party Leonardo DiCaprio and Tobey Maguire were seen celebrating at a private Super Bowl party in San Francisco, surprising fans with their energy as they enjoyed a live performance by Ice Cube just hours before the big game.

Project Hail Mary final trailer: Ryan Gosling and his alien friend try to save earth Ryan Gosling and his alien friend try to save the earth from extinction in new science-fiction film, Project Hail Mary. The movie is based on Andy Weir's bestselling novel, titled The Martian.

Fahadh Faasil shares major update about his role in Mammootty-Mohanlal's Patriot Fahadh Faasil has revealed that he will portray the antagonist in Mahesh Narayanan's film Patriot, which also stars Malayalam cinema icons Mohanlal and Mammootty. The film is set for release on April 23.

Netflix teases Cliff Booth's next chapter with Brad Pitt back in form. Watch here Netflix has surprised movie enthusiasts with the first teaser of The Adventures of Cliff Booth, marking Brad Pitt's return as the iconic stuntman from Once Upon a Time in Hollywood. The retro-styled preview, released during Super Bowl Sunday, promises a thrilling 1970s journey with a blend of classic rock, humour and vintage Hollywood charm.

Sivakarthikeyan meets Ajith in Abu Dhabi, praises his passion for motorsports Sivakarthikeyan visited Ajith Kumar at the Yas Marina Circuit in Abu Dhabi. The Good Bad Ugly actor is participating in the Asian Le Mans Series endurance race as part of the Yas Speed Festival.

BTS confirm free ARIRANG comeback concert in Seoul. Here's how to attend Global superstars BTS announce a free concert in Seoul to celebrate their ARIRANG album comeback. The event highlights BTS's unique approach to fan engagement with no ticket cost and a global live stream.

Krrish 4 shooting pushed as Hrithik Roshan-Aditya Chopra discuss budget: Report Significant budget disagreements between Hrithik Roshan and producer Aditya Chopra seem to have paused Krrish 4. The film was originally expected to begin filming later this year.

New update on Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar: The Revenge trailer Dhurandhar: The Revenge is gearing up for a grand trailer launch soon. The makers are planning a large-scale promotional push following the massive success of the first film.

Border 2 box office Day 17: Sunny Deol's 2nd Rs 300 crore film after Gadar 2  Sunny Deol created a new record as Border 2 finished its third weekend run at the box office in India. The film has become the second Rs 300 crore grosser for Sunny, and first for Varun Dhawan.

A slap in the face to US: Trump calls Bad Bunny's Super Bowl act worst ever US President Donald Trump has strongly criticised Bad Bunny's Super Bowl halftime show. He voiced concerns about the performance's content and its representation of American values.

Sunny Deol, Kill director Nikhil Nagesh Bhatt team up for action project: Report Sunny Deol is set to star in a new action thriller directed by Nikhil Nagesh Bhatt, produced by a major South Indian studio and a well-known Hindi producer. The actor's latest release, Border 2, is still running in theatres.

Bad Bunny headlines Super Bowl halftime with first Spanish-led set, Lady Gaga joins Bad Bunny was joined by Lady Gaga, Ricky Martin and other stars in a Super Bowl halftime show focused on Latin American culture and inclusivity, with direct calls for unity and love amid political tensions.

Shakti Mohan says dancers have no fixed hours, recalls 18-hour workdays Dancer-choreographer Shakti Mohan spoke about the realities of long working hours in the entertainment industry. In an exclusive interview, she also spoke about her journey after winning Dance India Dance, her dynamics with her sisters, and the changing landscape of dance opportunities in India.

Priyanka Chopra jets off to Los Angeles, carries a piece of Hyderabad with her After completing her schedule for Varanasi in Hyderabad, Priyanka Chopra left to Los Angeles to promote her upcoming action thriller, The Bluff, taking with her a piece of the city.

Kim Kardashian, Lewis Hamilton confirm romance with Super Bowl debut. Viral pics Kim Kardashian and Lewis Hamilton seemed to have hard-launched their relationship public during Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium in California, marking their first official outing as a couple after recent travels together.

general news.headline: Pakistan ready to play India in T20 World Cup. Only if 3 conditions met: ReportPakistan have held a high-level meeting with the ICC over their boycott of the India match in the T20 World Cup 2026. According to a report, the PCB has placed three conditions for any U-turn on its stance.

Kanpur tycoon's son crashes Lamborghini, FIR lists driver's identity unknownA Lamborghini crash in Kanpur has sparked controversy over police handling and the absence of the accused driver's name in the FIR. The incident has raised questions about preferential treatment and public safety in Uttar Pradesh.

How did Rahul Gandhi get an unpublished book by Gen Naravane?An unpublished book has reached Parliament, and it was by none other than former Army chief General MM Naravane (Retd) who oversaw one of the biggest India-China clashes since 1962. Did the publisher go ahead with printing Gen Naravane's Four Stars of Destiny even before the Defence Ministry approved the manuscript? How did Rahul Gandhi get a copy of the "unpublished" book?

I'm a Thakur: Bank employee abuses customer, tries to hit him in viral videoA video of a Kanpur bank employee verbally abusing a customer with casteist remarks has gone viral. The incident has sparked widespread outrage and calls for accountability against the employee.

March of the underdogs: How associate nations are adding flair to World CupT20 World Cup 2026: Last-ball drama and Associates have provided the thrill in the opening week of the tournament, exposing cricket's new reality: there are no minnows any more, only disruptors capable of rattling giants on the biggest stage globally.

Yet behind this image of calm and comfort sits one of the most powerful financial institutions on the planet.

Rs 3 lakh then, Rs 3 lakh now: A decade of unchanged fresher pay at TCS, InfosysFor nearly two decades, entry-level salaries in India's IT giants have remained frozen around Rs 3–4 LPA, even as education costs, urban living expenses, and corporate profits have surged. The result is a quiet collapse in real purchasing power for fresh engineering graduates, turning once-secure campus placements into a prolonged struggle for financial stability.

Live: Opposition likely to move no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha SpeakerParliament Budget session Live Updates: Parliament reconvened at 11 am today after a turbulent week marked by repeated disruptions over the India-US trade deal and references to an unpublished book by former Army chief Gen MM Naravane on the 2020 Galwan face-off with China. Opposition protests stalled proceedings in both Houses, forcing Prime Minister Narendra Modi to skip the Lok Sabha and instead reply to the President's address in the Rajya Sabha. Outside Parliament, Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi touched off a row by branding Congress-turned-BJP MP Ravneet Bittu a "traitor" for switching parties. With most of last week's business lost to disruptions, opposition floor leaders met at the office of Rajya Sabha Leader of the Opposition Mallikarjun Kharge ahead of today's sitting. The first phase of the Budget Session is set to conclude on February 13. Parliament will then adjourn for a recess before resuming on March 9. Stay with IndiaToday.in for latest updates

Sonam Kapoor's baby shower look champions effortless Indianwear. Inside picsSonam Kapoor, expecting her second child with Anand Ahuja, hosted an elegant godh bharai ceremony at her residence, marked by her distinctive maternity style and attended by figures from the film and fashion industries.

Tata Punch EV facelift revealed ahead of February 20 launchTata Motors has revealed the Punch EV facelift ahead of its February 20 launch, introducing subtle styling updates, a slightly reworked front-end design and potential feature upgrades, while retaining the same electric powertrain options.

Ghaziabad sisters' suicide: Father's lies about third wife surface amid probeThe tragic deaths of three minor sisters in Ghaziabad have revealed a complex family background marked by financial troubles and conflicting statements. The investigation is uncovering disturbing details about their home life and education, deepening the mystery.

'Delhi will become Khalistan': Bomb threat to Parliament, 9 schoolsThe bomb threats via email come amid a surge in hoaxes that have increasingly become routine in metros, stretching emergency services and causing widespread alarm among parents and school administrators.

Gurugram CEO's hard-hitting take on 'pressure cooker' parenting in India goes viralA post by a Gurugram-based CEO on "pressure cooker parenting" in India has triggered a discussion online, with many sharing personal stories and others calling for a more nuanced view.

Why Elon Musk wants a Moon city before his dream of colonising MarsElon Musk said his company SpaceX is prioritising plans to build a self-sustaining city on the Moon before attempting a permanent settlement on Mars.

Iran refuses to give up on uranium enrichment: No one has right to dictateIranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said Tehran would not be intimidated into changing its nuclear policy and expressed deep scepticism about the United States' intentions in ongoing negotiations.

Epstein's 'baby ranch' plan to impregnate women with his sperm, create super raceThese conversations were rooted in Jeffrey Epstein's fascination with transhumanism, a movement focused on enhancing human capabilities through science and technology. Critics have long warned that such thinking can echo discredited ideas linked to eugenics.

Matchday Preview: Italy set for World Cup debut as SA, Zimbabwe begin campaignsT20 World Cup 2026, Matchday preview: Day 3 of the tournament features three key matches, including Italy's debut at the grand stage of the T20 World Cup as they take on Scotland in the first fixture. On the other hand, Zimbabwe will take on Oman while South Africa will lock horns with Canada in the third fixture.

Why 'two under two' is more survival than cute for mothersHaving two kids under two may look cute on social media, with the matching outfits and the idea of growing up together, but in reality it is often a crisis for the mother.

Time for the truth: Epstein survivors release powerful ad on Super Bowl SundaySurvivors of Jeffrey Epstein have released a powerful Super Bowl advert demanding full transparency in his sex trafficking case. The ad urges Attorney General Pam Bondi to disclose all related records, highlighting ongoing calls for justice and truth.

Bodybuilder kills self after girlfriend of 3 years shows wedding invite, new sareeThe man was planning a Valentine's Day gift for his girlfriend when she revealed that her marriage had been finalised with another man and showed him her wedding invite.

Watch: Prakash Ambedkar's party workers vandalise builder's office amid remarks rowAngered over the delay in the builder's arrest despite the FIR in the casteist slur matter, Prakash Ambedkar's party workers entered the office premises and allegedly carried out vandalism, damaging property. Police later detained several party workers in connection with the incident.

India vs Nepal bilateral? Ex-India batter urges ICC reward for T20 World Cup show Aakash Chopra has urged for more bilaterals and tournament opportunities for Nepal after their thrilling four-run fight against England in Mumbai. He said rising teams deserve sustained support, not fleeting World Cup attention.

Pakistan ready to play India in T20 World Cup. Only if 3 conditions met: Report Pakistan have held a high-level meeting with the ICC over their boycott of the India match in the T20 World Cup 2026. According to a report, the PCB has placed three conditions for any U-turn on its stance.

Like Sachin, fast-track Vaibhav Sooryavanshi to Team India: Shashi Tharoor Congress MP Shashi Tharoor wants Vaibhav Sooryavanshi to be fast-tracked to the Indian team. Tharoor drew comparisons with Sachin Tendulkar and said that Vaibhav deserved higher honours.

Who is Dhakshineswar Suresh? India's Davis Cup star who left Netherlands stunned Dhakshineswar Suresh announced himself as India's newest Davis Cup hero, sweeping all three rubbers against the Netherlands. The 25-year-old's stunning weekend powered India into Qualifiers Round 2 for the first time since 2019.

Liverpool's Slot slams referee for Szoboszlai red-card vs City: Where's the rule book? Liverpool boss Arne Slot slammed the match officials after Dominik Szoboszlai's late red card in the chaotic 2-1 defeat to Manchester City at Anfield. Slot instead highlighted Marc Guehi's foul on Mohamed Salah.

ICC meeting with Pak done, Shehbaz Sharif to decide on India match Pakistan are expected to clarify their stance on boycotting the T20 World Cup 2026 match against India within 24 hours. The decision follows a key ICC meeting in Lahore as pressure mounts to resolve the tournament's biggest controversy.

On the other hand, Zimbabwe will take on Oman while South Africa will lock horns with Canada in the third fixture.

Dhakshineswar Suresh's triple-haul gives India historic Davis Cup win vs Netherlands Davis Cup: Dhakshineswar Suresh produced a historic triple-win performance, claiming both singles rubbers and the doubles to power India to a memorable 3-2 Davis Cup victory over the Netherlands on Sunday.

Hasaranga, Theekshana turn Colombo into Irish nightmare, guide SL to 20-run win Sri Lanka spinners Wanindu Hasaranga and Maheesh Theekshana spun a web around Ireland as they guided the hosts to a 20-run victory in their opening fixture of the T20 World Cup 2026 in Colombo.

Watch: Gautam Gambhir hosts special dinner for T20 World Cup team in New DelhiT20 World Cup: Indian head coach Gautam Gambhir hosted the team for a special dinner at his Delhi residence ahead of their T20 World Cup clash against Namibia, continuing his tradition of building team unity.

Donald Trump's good luck message to USA cricket team 24 hours after loss to IndiaT20 World Cup: Donald Trump posted a good luck message for Team USA's cricketers on Truth Social—24 hours after they'd already lost to India by 29 runs at the Wankhede Stadium.

Is there a rift between Kohli and Gambhir? BCCI secretary puts end to rumoursBCCI secretary Devajit Saikia dispels rumours of discord between Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir in the dressing room. Several reports in the media have claimed that the duo is not in a good relationship with each other in recent times.

Form aside, Babar Azam doesn't fit in Pakistan's T20I setup. Here's whyT20 World Cup: Babar Azam scored 15 runs off 18 balls at No.4 against the Netherlands. Pakistan managed to win the match by three wickets, but the bigger question remains: is Babar suited for a strong middle-order role in T20Is?

Dale Steyn's special message leaves Nepal bowler emotional after heroic fight vs EnglandT20 World Cup, ENG vs NEP: Former South African pacer Dale Steyn praised Nepal and offered his support after their four-run loss to England on Sunday at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.

Not here just to participate: Nepal captain sends warning after scaring EnglandNepal captain Rohit Paudel sent a big warning message to the rest of the teams of T20 World Cup 2026 after fighting valiantly against England in a thrilling fixture in Mumbai. Nepal finished their innings on 180/6 chasing a massive target of 185.

Keep your head high: Nepal win hearts after courageous fight against EnglandT20 World Cup, ENG vs NEP: Nepal produced a spirited performance against England but fell agonisingly short as England edged the thriller by four runs at the iconic Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. R Ashwin, Yuvraj Singh and others wished Nepal for their spirited efforts.

England hold off Nepal's spirited display in Mumbai to win T20 World Cup openerT20 World Cup 2026: Nepal pushed England to the final over in a thrilling T20 World Cup opener at Wankhede but fell agonizingly short by four runs. Their 12-year wait for a World Cup win continues despite a valiant effort.

SL vs IRE, Highlights: Sri Lanka take 20-run win over Ireland to begin campaignSL (Sri Lanka) vs IRE (Ireland) Highlights, T20 World Cup: A comprehensive bowling display from Sri Lanka have ensured that the co-hosts take the win in their opening game of the tournament.

No Whistle Podu in Chennai for T20 World Cup 2026? Senior cop clears the airT20 World Cup 2026: Fans at Chepauk were barred from carrying whistles during the T20 World Cup match, sparking confusion. A senior cop clarified no official ban exists, though the timing amid elections raised eyebrows.

Mujeeb bowled well, but Afghanistan couldn't build enough pressure: Jonathan TrottT20 World Cup, NZ vs AFG: Speaking to the reporters after the match, Jonathan Trott said that Mujeeb Ur Rahman bowled well, but Afghanistan couldn't build enough pressure on the New Zealand batters at the Chepauk.

Stubbs or Jansen? South Africa yet to figure out best combination in T20 World Cup, says Aiden MarkramT20 World Cup 2026, SA vs CAN: Speaking to the reporters, South Africa skipper Aiden Markram said that the Proteas are yet to make a call on their playing XI going into their opening game against Canada on Monday.

Vaibhav Sooryavanshi headlines ICC U19 Team of the Tournament, 3 Indians in XIThe ICC has announced the team of the tournament for the U19 World Cup. Vaibhav Sooryavanshi headlines the side which has 3 Indian players. India earlier hammered England in the final of the tournament.

Did Afghanistan miss Noor Ahmad trick? Trott clarifies surprise call after NZ lossT20 World Cup, NZ vs AFG: Jonathan Trott defended Afghanistan's decision to leave out Noor Ahmad against New Zealand, saying the selection was right and blaming the defeat on the pacers' failure to execute rather than the absence of a specialist spinner.

Mumbai or Kathmandu? Passionate Nepal fans paint Wankhede red in England clashNepal fans flocked to Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai for their T20 World Cup clash against England on Sunday. The passionate support underlined how Nepal's fans have long been the backbone of the national team, turning up in numbers and lending their voices wherever the side plays across the world.

Real cricket paglus: Fans pack Kolkata, Chennai for neutral T20 World Cup gamesKolkata and Chennai have brushed aside low-turnout worries at the T20 World Cup 2026 by turning up in strong numbers for neutral fixtures. From Eden Gardens to Chepauk, fans have shown the tournament buzz is alive.

New Zealand pass Afghanistan spin test in Chennai to lay down early markerT20 World Cup, NZ vs AFG: New Zealand recorded their highest run-chase in the history of the tournament, beating Afghanistan by five wickets on Sunday at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai.

ENG vs NEP Highlights: England survive Nepal scare, win by 4 runs in MumbaiENG (England) vs NEP (Nepal) Highlights, T20 World Cup: England held their nerve in the final over as Sam Curran was immensely accurate and pulled off a remarkable four-run victory for his team. Lokesh Bam's was crestfallen after his heroic 39* (20) ended in vain.

Bangladesh, Pakistan bhai bhai: BCB head meets PCB head ahead of ICC meetingThe Bangladesh Cricket Board chief has flown to meet PCB boss Mohsin Naqvi. The visit comes right ahead of ICC crucial meeting with Pakistan over their boycott of match against India.

Premier League: Carrick's United surge grows as Arsenal depth fuels title pushMichael Carrick's early impact at Manchester United is reshaping belief, while Arsenal face title-defining weeks ahead. With pressure mounting across the table, this Premier League run-in is quickly becoming a manager's survival test.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
